007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
010
011import java.util.function.DoubleFunction;
012import java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction;    // could use this instead
013import java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator; // could use this instead
014//https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/function/package-summary.html
015
016/**
017   Create a soild model of a surface of revolution around the y-axis.
018<p>
019   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surface_of_revolution#Rotating_a_function" target="_top">
020                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surface_of_revolution#Rotating_a_function</a>
021
022   @see ParametricSurface
023*/
024public class SurfaceOfRevolution extends ParametricSurface
025{
026   /**
027      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
028      based on a cosine function.
029   */
030   public SurfaceOfRevolution()
031   {
032      this( t -> 0.5 * (1 + Math.cos(Math.PI * t)),
033           -1.0, 1.0, 49, 49, MeshType.HORIZONTAL );
034   }
035
036
037   /**
038      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
039      with the given radial function, {@code r = r(y)},
040      the given parameter range along the y-axis, and
041      the given number of circles of latitude.
042
043      @param r   radius function
044      @param y1  beginning value along the y-axis
045      @param y2  ending value along the y-axis
046      @param n   number of circles of latitude
047      @param k   number of lines of longitude
048      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
049      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
050   */
051   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> r,
052                              final double y1, final double y2,
053                              final int n, final int k)
054   {
055      this(r, y1, y2, 0, 2*Math.PI, n, k);
056   }
057
058
059   /**
060      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis with
061      the given radial function, {@code r = r(y)}, the given
062      angular range for the sector of revolution, the given
063      parameter range along the y-axis, and the given number
064      of circles of latitude.
065
066      @param r       radius function
067      @param y1      beginning value along the y-axis
068      @param y2      ending value along the y-axis
069      @param theta1  beginning value of angular parameter range
070      @param theta2  ending value of angular parameter range
071      @param n       number of circles of latitude
072      @param k       number of lines of longitude
073      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
074      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
075   */
076   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> r,
077                              final double y1, final double y2,
078                              final double theta1, final double theta2,
079                              final int n, final int k)
080   {
081      super( (y,t) -> r.apply(y) * Math.cos(t),
082             (y,t) -> y,
083             (y,t) -> r.apply(y) * Math.sin(t),
084             y1, y2,
085             theta1, theta2,
086             n, k );
087   }
088
089
090   /**
091      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
092      of the given radial parametric curve.
093
094      @param x   first component function of the parametric curve
095      @param y   second component function of the parametric curve
096      @param s1  beginning parameter value
097      @param s2  ending parameter value
098      @param n   number of circles of latitude
099      @param k   number of lines of longitude
100      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
101      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
102   */
103   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> x,
104                              final DoubleFunction<Double> y,
105                              final double s1, final double s2,
106                              final int n, final int k)
107   {
108      this(x, y, s1, s2, 0, 2*Math.PI, n, k );
109   }
110
111
112   /**
113      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
114      of the given radial parametric curve and the given
115      angular range for the sector of revolution.
116
117      @param x       first component function of the parametric curve
118      @param y       second component function of the parametric curve
119      @param s1      beginning parameter value
120      @param s2      ending parameter value
121      @param theta1  beginning value of angular parameter range
122      @param theta2  ending value of angular parameter range
123      @param n       number of circles of latitude
124      @param k       number of lines of longitude
125      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
126      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
127   */
128   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> x,
129                              final DoubleFunction<Double> y,
130                              final double s1, final double s2,
131                              final double theta1, final double theta2,
132                              final int n, final int k)
133   {
134      super( (s,t) -> x.apply(s) * Math.cos(t),
135             (s,t) -> y.apply(s),
136             (s,t) -> x.apply(s) * Math.sin(t),
137             s1, s2,
138             theta1, theta2,
139             n, k,
140             MeshType.HORIZONTAL,
141             String.format("SurfaceOfRevolution(%d,%d)", n, k) );
142   }
143
144
145   /**
146      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
147      with the given radial function, {@code r = r(y)},
148      the given parameter range along the y-axis, and
149      the given number of circles of latitude.
150
151      @param r   radius function
152      @param y1  beginning value along the y-axis
153      @param y2  ending value along the y-axis
154      @param n   number of circles of latitude
155      @param k   number of lines of longitude
156      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
157      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
158      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
159   */
160   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> r,
161                              final double y1, final double y2,
162                              final int n, final int k,
163                              final MeshType type)
164   {
165      this(r, y1, y2, 0, 2*Math.PI, n, k, type);
166   }
167
168
169   /**
170      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis with
171      the given radial function, {@code r = r(y)}, the given
172      angular range for the sector of revolution, the given
173      parameter range along the y-axis, and the given number
174      of circles of latitude.
175
176      @param r       radius function
177      @param y1      beginning value along the y-axis
178      @param y2      ending value along the y-axis
179      @param theta1  beginning value of angular parameter range
180      @param theta2  ending value of angular parameter range
181      @param n       number of circles of latitude
182      @param k       number of lines of longitude
183      @param type    choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
184      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
185      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
186   */
187   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> r,
188                              final double y1, final double y2,
189                              final double theta1, final double theta2,
190                              final int n, final int k,
191                              final MeshType type)
192   {
193      super( (y,t) -> r.apply(y) * Math.cos(t),
194             (y,t) -> y,
195             (y,t) -> r.apply(y) * Math.sin(t),
196             y1, y2,
197             theta1, theta2,
198             n, k,
199             type );
200   }
201
202
203   /**
204      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
205      of the given radial parametric curve.
206
207      @param x   first component function of the parametric curve
208      @param y   second component function of the parametric curve
209      @param s1  beginning parameter value
210      @param s2  ending parameter value
211      @param n   number of circles of latitude
212      @param k   number of lines of longitude
213      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
214      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
215      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 2
216   */
217   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> x,
218                              final DoubleFunction<Double> y,
219                              final double s1, final double s2,
220                              final int n, final int k,
221                              final MeshType type)
222   {
223      this(x, y, s1, s2, 0, 2*Math.PI, n, k, type);
224   }
225
226
227   /**
228      Create a surface of revolution around the y-axis
229      of the given radial parametric curve and the given
230      angular range for the sector of revolution.
231
232      @param x       first component function of the parametric curve
233      @param y       second component function of the parametric curve
234      @param s1      beginning parameter value
235      @param s2      ending parameter value
236      @param theta1  beginning value of angular parameter range
237      @param theta2  ending value of angular parameter range
238      @param n       number of circles of latitude
239      @param k       number of lines of longitude
240      @param type    choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
241   */
242   public SurfaceOfRevolution(final DoubleFunction<Double> x,
243                              final DoubleFunction<Double> y,
244                              final double s1, final double s2,
245                              final double theta1, final double theta2,
246                              final int n, final int k,
247                              final MeshType type)
248   {
249      super( (s,t) -> x.apply(s) * Math.cos(t),
250             (s,t) -> y.apply(s),
251             (s,t) -> x.apply(s) * Math.sin(t),
252             s1, s2,
253             theta1, theta2,
254             n, k,
255             type,
256             String.format("SurfaceOfRevolution(%d,%d)", n, k) );
257   }
258}//SurfaceOfRevolution
